Wish You Were Here  (Waters, Gilmour)
------------------

[ch]C[/ch]                         [ch]D[/ch]
So, so you think you can tell,
             [ch]Am[/ch]                  [ch]G[/ch]
Heaven from Hell, blue skys from pain.
                     [ch]D[/ch]                       [ch]C[/ch]                    [ch]Am[/ch]

                      [ch]G[/ch]
Do you think you can tell?


                          [ch]C[/ch]                   [ch]D[/ch]
And did they get you to trade your heroes for ghosts,
                [ch]Am[/ch]                    [ch]G[/ch]                             [ch]D[/ch]

                  [ch]C[/ch]                        [ch]Am[/ch]                         [ch]G[/ch]

[ch]Em[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]  [ch]Em[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]  [ch]Em[/ch]  [ch]A[/ch]  [ch]Em[/ch]  [ch]A[/ch]


[ch]C[/ch]                               [ch]D[/ch]

           [ch]Am[/ch]                                   [ch]G[/ch]                    [ch]D[/ch]

                                  [ch]C[/ch]
Running over the same old ground. What have we found?
             [ch]Am[/ch]                         [ch]G[/ch]
The same old fears. Wish you were here!

==============

Album: Dark Side of the Moon

Words & Music by Roger Waters, Richard Wright, David Gilmour and Nicholas Mason

[Intro]

(Lead Guitar with percussion)


[Verse 1]

[ch]F#m[/ch]                                         [ch]A[/ch]
Ticking away the moments that make up a dull  day
[ch]E[/ch]                                              [ch]F#m[/ch]
Fritter and waste the hours  in an off hand way
                                           [ch]A[/ch]
Kicking around on a piece of groundin your hometown
[ch]E[/ch]                                                    [ch]F#m[/ch]
Wait-ing  for somone or something to show_you the way

[Chorus]

[ch]Dmaj7[/ch]                          [ch]Amaj7[/ch]
Tired of lying in the sunshine,stay-ing hometo watch the rain,
[ch]Dmaj7[/ch]                              [ch]Amaj7[/ch]                       [ch]Dmaj7[/ch]
you are young and life is long,and there is time to kill today.
                         [ch]C#m7[/ch]
And then one day,you findten years have got behind you.

name: Dear Mr President
tuning: E A D G B E

content.text:
Capo: fret 3


[Intro]

[ch]G[/ch]  [ch]D[/ch]  [ch]Em[/ch]  [ch]D[/ch]


[Verse 1]

[ch]G[/ch]                    [ch]D[/ch]                          [ch]Em[/ch]     [ch]D[/ch]  
   Dear Mr President, come take a walk with me
               [ch]G[/ch]                          [ch]D[/ch]
Let's pretend,  we're just two people and,  you're not better than me,
           [ch]Em[/ch]                                 [ch]D[/ch]
I'd like to, ask you some questions if we can, speak honestly.


[Pre-Chorus]

[ch]C[/ch]              [ch]Am7[/ch]                   [ch]G[/ch]                    [ch]D[/ch]
  What do you feel when you see the homeless on the street?
[ch]C[/ch]              [ch]Am7[/ch]                 [ch]G[/ch]               [ch]D[/ch]
  Who do you pray for at night before you go to sleep?
[ch]C[/ch]              [ch]Am7[/ch]                       [ch]Em[/ch]        [ch]D[/ch]
  What do you feel when you look in the mirror?
           [ch]C[/ch]     [ch]C[/ch]
Are you proud?


[Chorus]

             [ch]G[/ch]               [ch]D[/ch]         [ch]Am[/ch]     ([ch]Am/B[/ch])     [ch]C[/ch]
How do you sleep while the rest of us cry?
             [ch]G[/ch]             [ch]D[/ch]             [ch]Am[/ch]              [ch]C[/ch]
How do you dream when a mother has no chance to say goodbye?
             [ch]G[/ch]             [ch]D[/ch]         [ch]Am[/ch]        ([ch]Am/B[/ch])    [ch]C[/ch]
How do you walk with your head held high?
               [ch]Em[/ch]     [ch]D[/ch]       [ch]C[/ch]
Can you even look me in the eye?
		[ch]G[/ch]
And tell me why


[Instrumental]

([ch]G[/ch])  [ch]D[/ch]  [ch]Em[/ch]  [ch]D[/ch]


[Verse 2]

[ch]G[/ch]                  [ch]D[/ch]
  Dear Mr President, were you a lonely boy
[ch]Em[/ch]                      [ch]D[/ch]
  Were you a lonely boy?
                [ch]G[/ch]                        [ch]D[/ch]
How can you say, no child is left behind
                                    [ch]Em[/ch]
We're not dumb, and we're not blind
                                  [ch]D[/ch]
They're all sitting in your cells

while you pave the road to hell


[Pre-Chorus 2]

[ch]C[/ch]     	        [ch]Am7[/ch]                        [ch]G[/ch]                 [ch]D[/ch]
What kind of father might take his own daughter's rights away?
[ch]C[/ch]                 [ch]Am7[/ch]                          [ch]G[/ch]                   [ch]D[/ch]
And what kind of father might hate his own daughter if she were gay?
[ch]C[/ch]            [ch]Am7[/ch]                    [ch]G[/ch]          [ch]D[/ch]
I can only imagine what the first lady has to say
               [ch]Em[/ch]                          [ch]A[/ch]
You've come a long way, from whiskey and cocaine


[Chorus]

             [ch]G[/ch]               [ch]D[/ch]         [ch]Am[/ch]     ([ch]Am/B[/ch])     [ch]C[/ch]
How do you sleep while the rest of us cry?
             [ch]G[/ch]             [ch]D[/ch]             [ch]Am[/ch]              [ch]C[/ch]
How do you dream when a mother has no chance to say goodbye?
             [ch]G[/ch]             [ch]D[/ch]         [ch]Am[/ch]        ([ch]Am/B[/ch])    [ch]C[/ch]
How do you walk with your head held high?
               [ch]Em[/ch]     [ch]D[/ch]         [ch]C[/ch]
Can you even look me in the eye?


[Bridge]
                       [ch]Em[/ch]       [ch]G[/ch]
Let me tell you 'bout hard work
          [ch]Am[/ch]                     [ch]C[/ch]
Minimum wage with a baby on the way
                       [ch]Em[/ch]         [ch]G[/ch]
Let me tell you 'bout hard work
                  [ch]Am[/ch]                              [ch]C[/ch]
Re-building your house after the bombs took them away
                       [ch]Em[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]
Let me tell you 'bout hard work
           [ch]Am[/ch]                       [ch]C[/ch]
Building a bed out of a cardboard box
                        [ch]Em[/ch]         [ch]G[/ch]          [ch]Am[/ch]     [ch]Am/B[/ch]   [ch]C[/ch]
Let me tell you 'bout hard work, hard work, hard work
                             [ch]Em[/ch]         [ch]G[/ch]
You don't know nothing 'bout hard work, hard work
     [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]C[/ch]
Hard work!


[Outro]

[ch]G[/ch]       [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]     [ch]C[/ch]
How do you sleep at night?
[ch]Em[/ch]       [ch]G[/ch]       [ch]Am[/ch]        [ch]C[/ch]         [ch]G[/ch]
How do you walk, with your head held high

[ch]G[/ch]                   [ch]D[/ch]                                 [ch]Em[/ch]     [ch]D[/ch] 
  Dear Mr President  you'd never take a walk with me

ummm, would you.

name: Breathe
tuning: E A D G B E

content.text:
#----------------------------------PLEASE NOTE---------------------------------#

From tgtchb@tb3.chem.tue.nl (Harold C.L. Baur)
Subject: CRD: Breathe... (Floyd/DSOTM)
Date: 21 Mar 1994 17:38:30 +0100
Distribution: world


Here's the chords to Breathe... of DSOTM by Pink Floyd.
Anybody got the chords to "Money" ?
It would complete my collection of songs on DSOTM.

        Enjoy, Bo.

                Breathe

[ch]Em[/ch]      [ch]A[/ch]       [ch]Em[/ch]      [ch]A[/ch]       etc

[ch]Em[/ch]                      [ch]A[/ch]
Breathe, breathe in the air

[ch]Em[/ch]                 [ch]A[/ch]
Don't be afraid to care

[ch]Em[/ch]                    [ch]A[/ch]
Leave but don't leave me

[ch]Em[/ch]                             [ch]A[/ch]
Look around and chose your own ground

    [ch]C[/ch]
For long you live and high you fly

    [ch]Bm[/ch]
And smiles you'll give and tears you'll cry

    [ch]F[/ch]
And all you touch and all you see

   [ch]G[/ch]                  [ch]D7#9[/ch]   [ch]D7b9[/ch]
Is all your life will ever be

        D7#9(x5456x)
        D7b9(x5454x)

Run, run rabbit run
Dig that hole, forget the sun,
And when at last the work is done
Don't sit down it's time to start another one
For long you live and high you fly
But only if you ride the tide
And balanced on the biggest wave
You race toward an early grave.

        (and right after the last chord of "Time" theres...)
               Breathe Reprise

Home, home again
I like to be there when UI can
When I come in cold and tired
It's good to warm my bones beside the fire
Far away across the field
The tolling of the iron bell
Calls the faithful to their knees
To hear the softly spoken magic spells.
